declarations.comments:
A handle that lets the owner trigger some action with payload of type `a`.
Can be thought of as "inverse of `Event`".

The `Contravariant` instance can be used to map over the payload.
declarations.title: Callback

declarations.comments:
Create a new (`Event`, `Callback`) pair.
Firing the callback will cause the event to occur.
declarations.title: newCallback

declarations.comments: Trigger the action in Effect.
declarations.title: triggerCallback

declarations.comments: Triger the action each time a given `Event` fires.
declarations.title: attachEvent

declarations.comments:
Trigger a callback each time a DOM event fires.
The payload will be the DOM event. It is advised to `cmap` it to a nicer type.
declarations.title: attachDomEvent

declarations.comments:
Map over the callback payload using a `Dynamic` function.
The Dynamic value will be read at callback trigger time.
declarations.title: contramapCallbackDyn

declarations.comments:
Map over the callback payload using a `Dynamic` function. If it returns Nothing, the callback will not be triggered.
The Dynamic value will be read at callback trigger time.
declarations.title: contramapCallbackDynMaybe

declarations.comments:
Map over the callback payload using an effectful function.
The effect will be executed at callback trigger time.
declarations.title: contramapCallbackEffect

declarations.comments: A Callback that just ignores the input values.
declarations.title: nullCallback

declarations.comments:
Note: tracing will work only when something will subscribe
to returned Event.
declarations.title: traceEventWith

declarations.comments:
Note: tracing will work only when something will subscribe
to returned Dynamic.
declarations.title: traceDynWith

declarations.comments: Convenient syntax for building Attrs
XML namespace URI.
declarations.title: Namespace

declarations.comments: DOM node.
declarations.title: Node

declarations.comments: DOM event.
declarations.title: Event

declarations.comments: HTML event type, e.g. "click".
declarations.title: EventType

declarations.comments: Register an event listener. Returns unregister action.
declarations.title: addEventListener

declarations.comments: Create an element, optionally with namespace.
declarations.title: createElementNS

declarations.comments:
Return parent node of the node,
or Nothing if it has been detached.
declarations.title: parentNode

declarations.comments:
`insertBefore newNode nodeAfter parent`
Insert `newNode` before `nodeAfter` in `parent`
declarations.title: insertBefore

declarations.comments: `appendChild newNode parent`
declarations.title: appendChild

declarations.comments: Append a chunk of raw HTML to the end of the node.
declarations.title: appendRawHtml

declarations.comments:
`removeAllBetween from to`

Remove `from` and all nodes after `from` and before `to` from their
parent. `to` is not removed.

Assumes that `from` and `to` have the same parent,
and `from` is before `to`.
declarations.title: removeAllBetween

declarations.comments:
`moveAllBetweenInclusive from to parent`

Moves `from`, all nodes after `from` and before `to` and `to` to
`parent`.

Assumes that `from` and `to` have the same parent,
and `from` is before `to`.
declarations.title: moveAllBetweenInclusive

declarations.comments: JS `Event.preventDefault()`.
declarations.title: preventDefault

declarations.comments: Get `innerHTML` of a node.
declarations.title: innerHTML

declarations.comments: Register a DOM event listener.
declarations.title: onDomEvent

children.comments:
Initialize a widget without displaying it immediately.
Returns the `value` and a monadic action (`widget`) to display the widget.

When the `widget` computation is executed twice, the widget should only
appear in the latest place it is displayed.
children.title: detach

declarations.comments: Attach static attributes to the node.
declarations.title: attrs

declarations.comments:
Attach a dynamically-changing map of attributes to the node.

The set of attributes must be distinct from the attributes set by other
uses of `attrs` or `attrsD` on the same element.
declarations.title: attrsD

declarations.comments:
Attach a single CSS class to the element.

Note: if using this property:
- the `class` attribute must not be used,
- the provided class name must be distinct from class names used in other properties from this module.
declarations.title: class_

declarations.comments:
Attach an array of CSS classes to the element.

Note: if using this property:
- the `class` attribute must not be used,
- the provided class names must be distinct from class names used in other properties from this module.
declarations.title: classes

declarations.comments:
Attach a dynamically-changing array of CSS classes to the element.

Note: if using this property:
- the `class` attribute must not be used,
- the provided class names must be distinct from class names used in other properties from this module.
declarations.title: classesD

declarations.comments:
Conditionally attach a CSS class to the element. The class will be present if the condition is true.

Note: if using this property:
- the `class` attribute must not be used,
- the provided class name must be distinct from class names used in other properties from this module.
declarations.title: classWhenD

declarations.comments: `classUnlessD cond` = `classWhenD (not cond)`
declarations.title: classUnlessD

declarations.comments: DOM node.
declarations.title: Node

declarations.comments: XML namespace URI.
declarations.title: Namespace

declarations.comments: HTML event type, e.g. "click".
declarations.title: EventType

declarations.comments: DOM event.
declarations.title: Event

declarations.comments:
`removeAllBetween from to`

Remove `from` and all nodes after `from` and before `to` from their
parent. `to` is not removed.

Assumes that `from` and `to` have the same parent,
and `from` is before `to`.
declarations.title: removeAllBetween

declarations.comments: JS `Event.preventDefault()`.
declarations.title: preventDefault

declarations.comments:
Return parent node of the node,
or Nothing if it has been detached.
declarations.title: parentNode

declarations.comments:
`moveAllBetweenInclusive from to parent`

Moves `from`, all nodes after `from` and before `to` and `to` to
`parent`.

Assumes that `from` and `to` have the same parent,
and `from` is before `to`.
declarations.title: moveAllBetweenInclusive

declarations.comments:
`insertBefore newNode nodeAfter parent`
Insert `newNode` before `nodeAfter` in `parent`
declarations.title: insertBefore

declarations.comments: Get `innerHTML` of a node.
declarations.title: innerHTML

declarations.comments: Create an element, optionally with namespace.
declarations.title: createElementNS

declarations.comments: Append a chunk of raw HTML to the end of the node.
declarations.title: appendRawHtml

declarations.comments: `appendChild newNode parent`
declarations.title: appendChild

declarations.comments: Register an event listener. Returns unregister action.
declarations.title: addEventListener

declarations.comments: Convenient syntax for building Attrs

modules.name: Specular.Dom.Node.Class
modules.comments: Module preserved only for backwards compatibility. Use Specular.Dom.Browser instead.

declarations.comments: Runs a widget in the specified parent element. Returns the result and cleanup action.
declarations.title: runWidgetInNode

declarations.comments: Runs a widget in the specified parent element and discards cleanup action.
declarations.title: runMainWidgetInNode

declarations.comments: Runs a widget in `document.body` and discards cleanup action.
declarations.title: runMainWidgetInBody

declarations.comments: Lift a `Widget` into any `MonadWidget` monad.
declarations.title: liftWidget

declarations.comments:
`buttonOnClick attrs body` - Creates a HTML `<button>` element with the
specified dynamic attributes and body.

Returns an Event that occurs when the button is clicked.
declarations.title: buttonOnClick

declarations.comments:
A <select> element with static list of options.
The returned Dynamic represents the currently selected value.
declarations.title: selectInput

declarations.comments: A <select> element with static list of options.
declarations.title: selectView

declarations.comments:
Pull is a computation that reads a value given current time.

Invariant: Pull computations are always idempotent (`forall x :: Pull a. x *> x = x`).
declarations.title: Pull

declarations.comments:
A source of occurences.

During a frame, an Event occurs at most once with a value of type a.

Event is a functor. It is not, however, an Applicative. There is no
meaningful interpretation of `pure` (when would the event occur?).
There is an interpretation of `apply` (Event that fires when the input
events coincide), but it's not very useful.
declarations.title: Event

children.comments: This instance allows use of the Boolean operators `(||)` and `(&&)` directly on `Dynamic Bool`.
children.title: heytingAlgebraDynamic

declarations.comments:
`Dynamic a` represents a _dynamically changing value_ of type `a`. The
current value may be queried at any time (using `current`), and it's
possible to be notified of changes (using `changed`).
declarations.title: Dynamic

declarations.comments: Behaviors are time-changing values that can be read, but not subscribed to.
declarations.title: Behavior

declarations.comments: A "type class alias" for the constraints required by most FRP primitives.
declarations.title: MonadFRP

declarations.comments:
Make a Dynamic that only changes value when the input Dynamic changes
value, and the new value is not equal to the previous value with respect to
the given equality test.
declarations.title: uniqDynBy

declarations.comments: Make an Event that occurs when the current value of the given Dynamic (an Event) occurs.
declarations.title: switch

declarations.comments: Read a value of a Behavior.
declarations.title: readBehavior

declarations.comments:
Create an Event that can be triggered externally.
Each `fire` will run a frame where the event occurs.
declarations.title: newEvent

declarations.comments: Construct a new root Dynamic that can be changed from `Effect`-land.
declarations.title: newDynamic

declarations.comments: Create a new Behavior whose value can be modified outside a frame.
declarations.title: newBehavior

declarations.comments: An Event that never occurs.
declarations.title: never

declarations.comments:
An Event that occurs when any of the events occur.
If some of them occur simultaneously, the occurence value is that of the
leftmost one.
declarations.title: leftmost

declarations.comments:
Returns a Dynamic that holds the latest `Just` value of the input Dynamic
after execution of this function. If the input currently has value `Nothing`, the resulting
Dynamic will have the value `Nothing` until the input changes to a `Just`.

The resulting Dynamic changes when the input changes to a value that is a `Just`,
and doesn't change when the input changes to `Nothing`.
declarations.title: latestJust

declarations.comments: `holdDyn initialValue event` returns a `Dynamic` that starts with `initialValue`, and changes to the occurence value of `event` when `event` fires
declarations.title: holdDyn

declarations.comments:
Like `foldDyn`, but the Dynamic will not update if the folding function
returns Nothing.
declarations.title: foldDynMaybe

declarations.comments:
`foldDyn f x e` - Make a Dynamic that will have the initial value `x`,
and every time `e` fires, its value will update by applying `f` to the
event occurence value and the old value.

On cleanup, the Dynamic will stop updating in response to the event.
declarations.title: foldDyn

declarations.comments:
The Behavior representing the current value of the Dynamic.
When it is changing (the change event occurs), it has the new value.

The value of `current x` is always the value of the latest occurence of
`changed x`, if it has ever occured.
declarations.title: current

declarations.comments: An Event that fires every time the Dynamic changes.
declarations.title: changed_

declarations.comments: An Event that fires with the new value every time the Dynamic changes.
declarations.title: changed

declarations.comments:
Execute a monadic action in a Replaceable monad only if the given Dynamic
has value `true`.
declarations.title: whenD

declarations.comments:
Execute a monadic action in a Replaceable monad only if the given Dynamic
has value `true`.
declarations.title: unlessD

declarations.comments:
A primitive similar to Dynamic. The difference is: while Dynamic always
has a value, WeakDynamic has a value always after some point, but for
some time after construction it may be without value.

A Dynamic can be always converted to a WeakDynamic using `weaken`.
declarations.title: WeakDynamic

declarations.comments:
Convert a Dynamic to a WeakDynamic. It will have the same value as the
original Dynamic, and will change whenever the original Dynamic changes.
declarations.title: weaken

declarations.comments:
Make a WeakDynamic that only changes value when the input WeakDynamic changes
value, and the new value is not equal to the previous value with respect to
the given equality test.
declarations.title: uniqWeakDynBy

declarations.comments:
Make an Event that occurs when the given WeakDynamic has a value, and the
value (an Event) occurs.
declarations.title: switchWeakDyn

declarations.comments:
Invoke the handler immediately if the WeakDynamic has a value currently,
and invoke it every time it changes, until cleanup.
declarations.title: subscribeWeakDyn_

declarations.comments:
Invoke the handler immediately if the WeakDynamic has a value currently,
and invoke it every time it changes, until cleanup.
declarations.title: subscribeWeakDyn

declarations.comments:
Make a WeakDynamic that will have no value, but will acquire one when the Event fires.
It will also change every time the Event fires.
declarations.title: holdWeakDyn

declarations.comments: An Event that fires every time a WeakDynamic changes, with the new value.
declarations.title: changedW

declarations.comments: Start an asynchronous Aff computation. It will be cancelled on cleanup.
declarations.title: startAff

declarations.comments:
On each observed value of the Dynamic,
- if it's Nothing, the resulting Dynamic will have value NotRequested.
- if it's a Just, the contents will be executes asynchronously and the
  resulting Dynamic will obtain value Loaded x. During the request execution
  the result Dynamic will have value Loading.

  If the input Dynamic changes value while a request is in progress, it will be cancelled
  using Aff's (Aff's) cancellation mechanism. This ensures that the value of the resulting Dynamic
  will eventually be that of the most recent value of the input Dynamic,
  independent of the order of arrival of the responses.
declarations.title: asyncRequestMaybe

declarations.comments: Like `asyncRequestMaybe`, but without the Nothing case.
declarations.title: asyncRequest

declarations.comments:
Run asynchronous action when an Event occurs.
The returned Event will fire when such an action completes.

Note: the results may arrive in a different order than the requests.
declarations.title: performEvent

declarations.comments:
Pull is a computation that reads a value given current time.

Invariant: Pull computations are always idempotent (`forall x :: Pull a. x *> x = x`).
declarations.title: Pull

declarations.comments:
A source of occurences.

During a frame, an Event occurs at most once with a value of type a.

Event is a functor. It is not, however, an Applicative. There is no
meaningful interpretation of `pure` (when would the event occur?).
There is an interpretation of `apply` (Event that fires when the input
events coincide), but it's not very useful.
declarations.title: Event

declarations.comments: An Event that never occurs.
declarations.title: never

declarations.comments:
An Event that occurs when any of the events occur.
If some of them occur simultaneously, the occurence value is that of the
leftmost one.
declarations.title: leftmost

declarations.comments: Behaviors are time-changing values that can be read, but not subscribed to.
declarations.title: Behavior

declarations.comments: Read a value of a Behavior.
declarations.title: readBehavior

children.comments: This instance allows use of the Boolean operators `(||)` and `(&&)` directly on `Dynamic Bool`.
children.title: heytingAlgebraDynamic

declarations.comments:
`Dynamic a` represents a _dynamically changing value_ of type `a`. The
current value may be queried at any time (using `current`), and it's
possible to be notified of changes (using `changed`).
declarations.title: Dynamic

declarations.comments:
The Behavior representing the current value of the Dynamic.
When it is changing (the change event occurs), it has the new value.

The value of `current x` is always the value of the latest occurence of
`changed x`, if it has ever occured.
declarations.title: current

declarations.comments: An Event that fires with the new value every time the Dynamic changes.
declarations.title: changed

declarations.comments: An Event that fires every time the Dynamic changes.
declarations.title: changed_

declarations.comments: Make an Event that occurs when the current value of the given Dynamic (an Event) occurs.
declarations.title: switch

declarations.comments:
Returns a Dynamic that holds the latest `Just` value of the input Dynamic
after execution of this function. If the input currently has value `Nothing`, the resulting
Dynamic will have the value `Nothing` until the input changes to a `Just`.

The resulting Dynamic changes when the input changes to a value that is a `Just`,
and doesn't change when the input changes to `Nothing`.
declarations.title: latestJust

declarations.comments: Construct a new root Dynamic that can be changed from `Effect`-land.
declarations.title: newDynamic

declarations.comments: `holdDyn initialValue event` returns a `Dynamic` that starts with `initialValue`, and changes to the occurence value of `event` when `event` fires
declarations.title: holdDyn

declarations.comments:
`foldDyn f x e` - Make a Dynamic that will have the initial value `x`,
and every time `e` fires, its value will update by applying `f` to the
event occurence value and the old value.

On cleanup, the Dynamic will stop updating in response to the event.
declarations.title: foldDyn

declarations.comments:
Like `foldDyn`, but the Dynamic will not update if the folding function
returns Nothing.
declarations.title: foldDynMaybe

declarations.comments:
Make a Dynamic that only changes value when the input Dynamic changes
value, and the new value is not equal to the previous value with respect to
the given equality test.
declarations.title: uniqDynBy

declarations.comments:
Create an Event that can be triggered externally.
Each `fire` will run a frame where the event occurs.
declarations.title: newEvent

declarations.comments: Create a new Behavior whose value can be modified outside a frame.
declarations.title: newBehavior

declarations.comments: A "type class alias" for the constraints required by most FRP primitives.
declarations.title: MonadFRP

declarations.comments: Logical time.
declarations.title: Time

declarations.comments:
Pull is a computation that reads a value given current time.

Invariant: Pull computations are always idempotent (`forall x :: Pull a. x *> x = x`).
declarations.title: Pull

declarations.comments: Computations that occur during a Frame.
declarations.title: Frame

declarations.comments:
`dynamicListWithIndex dynArray handler`
Render a list of items from `dynArray`. Each item will be rendered by `handler`.

When the array changes, indexes that exist in both old and new array are _updated_,
e.g. the Dynamics passed to handlers are changed. As an optimization,
when old and new item values are the same JS object (using `===`), the
Dynamic is not updated.

If the array grows (a new index appears), a new handler is invoked.

The resulting Dynamic represents return values from all the handlers.
declarations.title: dynamicListWithIndex

declarations.comments: Like `listWithIndex`, but operates on `WeakDynamics`.
declarations.title: weakDynamicListWithIndex

declarations.comments:
Execute a monadic action in a Replaceable monad only if the given Dynamic
has value `true`.
declarations.title: whenD

declarations.comments:
Execute a monadic action in a Replaceable monad only if the given Dynamic
has value `true`.
declarations.title: unlessD

declarations.comments:
A primitive similar to Dynamic. The difference is: while Dynamic always
has a value, WeakDynamic has a value always after some point, but for
some time after construction it may be without value.

A Dynamic can be always converted to a WeakDynamic using `weaken`.
declarations.title: WeakDynamic

declarations.comments: An Event that fires every time a WeakDynamic changes, with the new value.
declarations.title: changedW

declarations.comments:
Convert a Dynamic to a WeakDynamic. It will have the same value as the
original Dynamic, and will change whenever the original Dynamic changes.
declarations.title: weaken

declarations.comments:
Make a WeakDynamic that will have no value, but will acquire one when the Event fires.
It will also change every time the Event fires.
declarations.title: holdWeakDyn

declarations.comments:
Make an Event that occurs when the given WeakDynamic has a value, and the
value (an Event) occurs.
declarations.title: switchWeakDyn

declarations.comments:
Invoke the handler immediately if the WeakDynamic has a value currently,
and invoke it every time it changes, until cleanup.
declarations.title: subscribeWeakDyn

declarations.comments:
Invoke the handler immediately if the WeakDynamic has a value currently,
and invoke it every time it changes, until cleanup.
declarations.title: subscribeWeakDyn_

declarations.comments:
Make a WeakDynamic that only changes value when the input WeakDynamic changes
value, and the new value is not equal to the previous value with respect to
the given equality test.
declarations.title: uniqWeakDynBy

children.comments:
The `Semigroup` instance for effects allows you to run two effects, one
after the other, and then combine their results using the result type's
`Semigroup` instance.
children.title: semigroupEffect

children.comments:
If you have a `Monoid a` instance, then `mempty :: Effect a` is defined as
`pure mempty`.
children.title: monoidEffect

declarations.comments:
A native effect. The type parameter denotes the return type of running the
effect, that is, an `Effect Int` is a possibly-effectful computation which
eventually produces a value of the type `Int` when it finishes.
declarations.title: Effect

declarations.comments: A mutable FIFO queue.
declarations.title: Queue

declarations.comments: Create a new empty queue.
declarations.title: new

declarations.comments: Add an element onto the end of the queue.
declarations.title: enqueue

declarations.comments:
Iterate over the queue, calling the specified function on each element in sequence.

Postcondition: When `drain` returns, the queue is empty.

If the function calls `enqueue`, the newly added elements will be processed in the run of `drain`.

If the function calls `drain`, the inner `drain` will consume all elements
and it will be the last invocation of the callback function in the outer
`drain`.
declarations.title: drain

declarations.comments: Keys used to index UniqueMap.
declarations.title: Unique

declarations.comments: A mutable associative container that generates a key on each insert.
declarations.title: UniqueMap

declarations.comments: Constructs an empty UniqueMap.
declarations.title: new

declarations.comments: Inserts the given value into the map under a new unique key.
declarations.title: insert

declarations.comments: Returns the value associated with a particular key, or Nothing if it's not there.
declarations.title: lookup

declarations.comments: Removes the value associated with the given key from the map.
declarations.title: delete

declarations.comments: Returns all values inserted into the map so far.
declarations.title: values

declarations.comments: Old name for `new`.
declarations.title: newRef

declarations.comments: Create a new Ref with an initial value.
declarations.title: new

declarations.comments: Old name for `value`
declarations.title: refValue

declarations.comments: The current value of the Ref, as a Dynamic.
declarations.title: value

declarations.comments: Old name for `modify`.
declarations.title: refUpdate

declarations.comments: A Callback to modify value of this Ref using a function.
declarations.title: modify

declarations.comments: Old name for `set`.
declarations.title: refUpdateConst

declarations.comments: A Callback to overwrite value of this Ref.
declarations.title: set
